eadid.publicid: -//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NcD::Robert Goodloe Harper papers, 1818-1821 //EN

titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Goodloe Harper papers, 1818-1821
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: The collection contains a letter, 1818, from Robert Hills concerning construction projects in Baltimore, Maryland; a letter, 1821, from the Italian sculptor Raimondo Trentanove concerning a bust of George Washington; and two business letters.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Robert Goodloe Harper Papers, 1818-1821, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Goodloe Harper was a resident of Baltimore, Maryland.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a letter, 1818, from Robert Hills concerning construction projects in Baltimore, Maryland; a letter, 1821, from the Italian sculptor Raimondo Trentanove concerning a bust of George Washington; and two business letters.
